newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL palm oil up at close in post-holiday trade.
newsitem.headline: KL palm oil up at close in post-holiday trade.

text.p: PALM OIL FUTURES PALM OIL PHYSICAL

PALM OIL FUTURES -Prices ended higher in post-holiday trading with supply tightness and technical factors aiding sentiment. The market resumed trading today after closing from Feb 6 to 11 for the Chinese and Moslem festivals, and activity was mainly on spread trades and speculative buying.
PALM OIL PHYSICAL- Dealing was thin with most players away for festive holidays. Interest was seen among selected products.
Activities were mostly on spread trades and traders expect the market to pick up more business next week when players return from the long the long holidays.

"Fundamentally and technically, the market looks good," the a trader said. "There is the possibility that nearby supply may be tight as the long break of the twin festivals had forced many plantations to stop work."
"Output in January and February is estimated to have a double-digit fall," he said, without disclosing any estimates.
Dealing was cautious with volume on the futures market totalling 1,369 lots at the close.
Double-digits gains were seen in the futures market, they said. Third month April futures contract was up 13 ringgit at 1,321 ringgit ($531.05) a tonne after trading in 16-ringgit range.
Physicals Feb (south) crude palm oil was offered 1,360 ringgit against bids of 1,350, Feb (central) at 1,360 and bids at 1,352.50 and Feb (north) at 1,355 against 1,345.
Mar (south) saw offers at 1,355 with bids at 1,347.50, and Mar (central) at 1,350 against bids 1,342.50.
Among refined products, Feb RBD palm oil was offered at $572.50 a tonne FOB Malaysia, Mar at $570 and Apr/May/Jun at $560.
Feb RBD palm olein saw offers at $602.50, Mar at $600 and Apr/May/Jun at $590. Apr was traded at $592.50 and $590.
Feb/Mar RBD palm stearin was offered at $470 and Feb/Mar palm fatty acid distillate saw sellers at $307.50. -- Tan Lee Lee - (603-230-7510) ($1 =2.4875 ringgit)
